intro: Dianthus tenuifolius subsp. serpentini, commonly known as the serpentine campion, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and clusters of pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils, often on slopes and cliffs. It is a perennial species that thrives in full sun and has a compact growth habit. Its name refers to its association with serpentine soils, which are rich in minerals but low in nutrients.
